intro: Rheedia mangorensis, commonly known as the Mangorensis Rheedia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Rheedia mangorensis typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
